subject: Leadership
title: Accountability in Teams
description: A quick, practical guide to Accountability in Teams.

hook.text: A team member misses every deadline. Nobody says anything. The team resents it while the leader stays quiet.

buildup.text: Accountability means holding each other to standards. In weak teams only the leader does it. In strong teams, peers do.

discovery.text: Peer accountability is more powerful than boss-driven. People care more about letting down colleagues than managers.

twist.text: Accountability without trust feels like punishment. With trust, it feels like respectâ€”holding you to a high bar.

climax.text: Build accountability with public commitments, visible progress tracking, and normalized direct peer feedback.

punchline.text: Accountability isn't policing. It's caring enough to speak up.

quiz.question: Why is peer accountability more effective than boss-driven accountability?
options: People care more about letting down colleagues
